Legal_Issue: Was the Board's credibility determination regarding the applicant's refugee claim reasonable?
Evidence_Assessment: Delayed extortion onset, MS behavior inconsistency, nickname discrepancies, demeanor analysis
Credibility_Factor: Nickname discrepancies, inconsistent behavior, delayed reporting, demeanor
Legal_Rule: Credibility findings are reviewed on a reasonableness standard, requiring a reliable evidentiary basis and avoiding unfounded speculation
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim initially denied due to lack of credibility
Key_Evidence_Considered: Timing of extortion, MS behavior, nickname usage, demeanor
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged the reasonableness of the credibility assessment
Court_Result: Remanded for redetermination by a different panel
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on reasonableness review
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and credibility
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection division hearing, judicial review
